Can you get thread dumps from the heritrix instance and try and figure 
why its stopped accepting connections and what its doing w/ that 100% of 
CPU (Would be particularly good if you could get dumps across the 
transistion going from accepting JMX connections to its going deaf to 
JMX connections)?  If you browse to the UI, it all seems to be working 
fine?  Anything in the UI Alerts list?
St.Ack

acidbluebriggs wrote:
>
> So, I have a simple class to invoke crawl jobs on Heritrix via JMX.
> It seems to work fine for about 600 total jobs submitted, but
> eventually I cannot connect to the MBean server (or the WebUI); I'll
> just get socket timeout exceptions. I can't connect via either the
> JConsole application nor the command line also.
>
> The process is that I have 10 heritrix instances up (within the one
> jvm) and I look for an available crawler mbean (via a jmx query) when
> a job needs to be submitted.
>
> Does anyone know of any issues like this? I am using Heritrix 1.12.1
> and java build 1.5.0_11-b03.
>
> I see no OOME or anything in the logs. But, if I run 'top' I can see
> that the CPU usage has spiked to 100%. But, the current crawls I have
> seem to be stalled (no more output to the logs or the arc files have
> been appended for over a day).
>
> I hope this is enough info to jog some memories if the issue has been
> seen before.
>
> --briggs
>
>
